newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Family killed by Vietnam's Unification train.
newsitem.headline: Family killed by Vietnam's Unification train.

text.p: A family of three, including a pregnant woman, has been killed while crossing the tracks in front of Vietnam's north-south "Unification train".

Police in a district to the south of Hanoi said on Friday the family had been knocked down as they attempted to cross the tracks at a point where the oncoming train was hidden from view. The accident happened on Wednesday and further details were not available.
Vietnam's Unification train is the name give to the service which runs between Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City, the former South Vietnam capital.
Accidents on Vietnam's old rail system are commonplace. Trains are slow-moving and people have been killed after falling asleep on the tracks.
